div1.p: The writer discusses an entry, in the National Cyclopedia of American Biography, on his unidentified father.

div1.head: Letter to Jack [s.n.], September 28, 1927

opener.dateline:
The Highlands, Apt. 307,
Washington, D. C.
September 28, 1927.

div1.p:
I am enclosing a biographic sketch of Father, just brought me
in person, by the Associate Editor of The National Cyclopedia of American
Biography, James T. White & Co., Publishers, New York. The sketch is signed
R. W. R. I have made some (expurgated!) marginal notes and you willdoubtless
find other things which should be taken out, or put in, as Mr. Vedder, the above-
mentioned Associate Editor, said that he would be very grateful for any suggestions:
corrections: amplifications etc.

Would you have time to go over this sketch (it really should be re-
written, but I doubt much the advisability of that) and help me out, as you
have so often done previously: Mr. Vedder says there is no great hurry, but
that he would like the sketch back in a couple of weeks. He thinks, of course,
that whatever changes are made will be done by myself. I read the sketch while
he was here and told him that certain changes would have to be made--pointed a
few out (re the Nobel Prize etc.), but, of course, also expressed my appreciation
and we parted in most friendly wise.

It was surely good to hear Susan's voice on the telephone last night. I
shall miss you all a lot over here.

With much love to the Susans and looking forward to seeing you, them
and the rest of your household (Ebie: the twins: the cats etc) soon,
div1.closer:
Most truly,
P. S. Have you heard any details yet about Adrian Stokes death at Lagos?
A grievous pity, but I hope not a waste. I've only seen the newspaper accounts
and am very anxious to know more about it.
O. F. VEDDER
ASSOCIATE EDITOR
3913 Spruce St
Phila. Pa
NATIONAL CYCLOPEDIA
OF AMERICAN BIOGRAPHY
70 FIFTH AVENUE
NEW YORK CITY
